replies.msg:
非高手 但係我嘅理解係

1. 從effective field theory 角度嚟睇, 個theory 會 diverge (in the UV) 主要係因為我哋太自大, 以為個theory works in all energy scale。當然真實上唔係咁 所以我地需要 “parametrize our ignorance”, 例如用一個hard cut off 表示喺呢個 cut off之上，我哋個theory就唔work。當然你真正計數時要顧及好多問題, 例如你個regularisation scheme 係唔係consistent with the theory’s symmetry, 不過個philosophy冇變到 - 你係modify緊個theory嘅 UV structure。理論上high energy behaviours 係唔會影響到 low energy physics (所謂嘅 “decoupling”)，所以我哋expect 最尾嘅答案應該係 regulator-independent。(不過唔一定, 請參考 UV-IR mixing)

2. 而Renormalization 則係我哋計physical observable嘅時候唔記得咗lagrangian 入面嘅parameters （例如mass/ coupling constant) 其實係冇被define過。所以當我哋express observable should in terms of “bare” parameters, 個expression係冇意思。我哋首先要 define 啲 parameters (所謂嘅 “renormalization scheme”) 去令到佢哋physically meaningful, 然後express observables in terms of physical parameters。呢個過程就係renormalization。個idea係 lagrangian parameters係你個theory嘅input，當你喺某個energy scale 度咗佢哋之後，你就可以make predictions。

當然有人會覺得咁樣做其實係多舊魚，理論上應該有方法直接計finite results而唔使做咁多intermediate steps，詳情可以查下 “causal perturbation theory”。我唔熟呢方面所以我唔想亂噏

Sor for 1999

quote.msg:
有冇高手講下regularisation 同 renormalisation
究竟係唔係嚴謹嘅數黎

非高手 但係我嘅理解係

1. 從effective field theory 角度嚟睇, 個theory 會 diverge (in the UV) 主要係因為我哋太自大, 以為個theory works in all energy scale。當然真實上唔係咁 所以我地需要 “parametrize our ignorance”, 例如用一個hard cut off 表示喺呢個 cut off之上，我哋個theory就唔work。當然你真正計數時要顧及好多問題, 例如你個regularisation scheme 係唔係consistent with the theory’s symmetry, 不過個philosophy冇變到 - 你係modify緊個theory嘅 UV structure。理論上high energy behaviours 係唔會影響到 low energy physics (所謂嘅 “decoupling”)，所以我哋expect 最尾嘅答案應該係 regulator-independent。(不過唔一定, 請參考 UV-IR mixing)

2. 而Renormalization 則係我哋計physical observable嘅時候唔記得咗lagrangian 入面嘅parameters （例如mass/ coupling constant) 其實係冇被define過。所以當我哋express observable should in terms of “bare” parameters, 個expression係冇意思。我哋首先要 define 啲 parameters (所謂嘅 “renormalization scheme”) 去令到佢哋physically meaningful, 然後express observables in terms of physical parameters。呢個過程就係renormalization。個idea係 lagrangian parameters係你個theory嘅input，當你喺某個energy scale 度咗佢哋之後，你就可以make predictions。

當然有人會覺得咁樣做其實係多舊魚，理論上應該有方法直接計finite results而唔使做咁多intermediate steps，詳情可以查下 “causal perturbation theory”。我唔熟呢方面所以我唔想亂噏

Sor for 1999

我只係玩過下 one-loop diagram爆無限，然後就做regularisation (好似見過dimensional regularisation ) 將d無限嘅terms（1/epsilon) 抽出黎

然後好似用renormalisation (MS bar scheme)，透過個Lagrangian d counter terms 食咗呢d 無限嘅terms。

最後個bare mass 同 coupling 就 renormalise 咗

問題：
1. 咁其實 regularisation 係 將個integral 睇成某個limit value, 而唔係佢真實嘅value? (e.g f(x=0) vs lim x->0 f(x) )

2. renormalised mass & coupling 係 depends on energy scale ? 如果係咁，個d standard model table嘅rest mass數值，其實係assume某個energy scale嘅數黎？

3. 呢種Renormalisation 同 Kenneth Wilson嘅 Renormalisation Group 其實係咪一樣

replies.msg:
好耐冇做QFT，分享一下睇法，如果我記錯野請屌。

其實用唔同energy scale計原則上唔影響observables，例如scattering cross-section。但用錯energy scale會令到個perturbation series (Feynman diagrams)有好大既log terms contribution，就好似人哋要求你用Taylor expansion計f(1.001)，你走去expand about f(2)而唔係f(1)，原則上答案一樣，但convergence難做左。而match左energy scale之後條數好計左，所以某個energy scale就有個具代表性既mass同埋coupling。（唔計SSB嗰啲特別情況）

SM quote既通常係0 energy masses couplings，但係QCD係confining所以light quarks既rest mass有既複雜。

quote.msg:
有冇高手講下regularisation 同 renormalisation
究竟係唔係嚴謹嘅數黎

非高手 但係我嘅理解係

1. 從effective field theory 角度嚟睇, 個theory 會 diverge (in the UV) 主要係因為我哋太自大, 以為個theory works in all energy scale。當然真實上唔係咁 所以我地需要 “parametrize our ignorance”, 例如用一個hard cut off 表示喺呢個 cut off之上，我哋個theory就唔work。當然你真正計數時要顧及好多問題, 例如你個regularisation scheme 係唔係consistent with the theory’s symmetry, 不過個philosophy冇變到 - 你係modify緊個theory嘅 UV structure。理論上high energy behaviours 係唔會影響到 low energy physics (所謂嘅 “decoupling”)，所以我哋expect 最尾嘅答案應該係 regulator-independent。(不過唔一定, 請參考 UV-IR mixing)

2. 而Renormalization 則係我哋計physical observable嘅時候唔記得咗lagrangian 入面嘅parameters （例如mass/ coupling constant) 其實係冇被define過。所以當我哋express observable should in terms of “bare” parameters, 個expression係冇意思。我哋首先要 define 啲 parameters (所謂嘅 “renormalization scheme”) 去令到佢哋physically meaningful, 然後express observables in terms of physical parameters。呢個過程就係renormalization。個idea係 lagrangian parameters係你個theory嘅input，當你喺某個energy scale 度咗佢哋之後，你就可以make predictions。

當然有人會覺得咁樣做其實係多舊魚，理論上應該有方法直接計finite results而唔使做咁多intermediate steps，詳情可以查下 “causal perturbation theory”。我唔熟呢方面所以我唔想亂噏

Sor for 1999

我只係玩過下 one-loop diagram爆無限，然後就做regularisation (好似見過dimensional regularisation ) 將d無限嘅terms（1/epsilon) 抽出黎

然後好似用renormalisation (MS bar scheme)，透過個Lagrangian d counter terms 食咗呢d 無限嘅terms。

最後個bare mass 同 coupling 就 renormalise 咗

問題：
1. 咁其實 regularisation 係 將個integral 睇成某個limit value, 而唔係佢真實嘅value? (e.g f(x=0) vs lim x->0 f(x) )

2. renormalised mass & coupling 係 depends on energy scale ? 如果係咁，個d standard model table嘅rest mass數值，其實係assume某個energy scale嘅數黎？

3. 呢種Renormalisation 同 Kenneth Wilson嘅 Renormalisation Group 其實係咪一樣

replies.msg:
1. 你可以咁講。但係個philosophy係改變個theory嘅UV behaviour such that 計到 finite results。如果直接當一個limit, 數學上其實好sketchy, 因為你exchange咗limit同埋integration嘅order。

2. 係同唔係。coupling constant嘅definition會involve到energy scale (the “renormalization scale” / “subtraction point”) 所以佢一定會有energy dependence (running coupling constant)。mass 有啲唔同因爲所謂嘅pole mass嘅definition係同energy scale冇關, 但係renormlaized mass (例如 MS-bar mass) 就可以depend on energy scale (running mass)。至於experimental values, experimentalists通常report嘅係pole mass (但唔一定, 尤其是quark mass), 而coupling constant 就會係refer緊某個得定嘅energy scale (通常係個實驗嘅energy scale)。

3. Conceptually 唔一樣。Wilsonian RG 講緊嘅係modify緊個high energy cut-off 嘅時候, low energy physics會點變 (Wilson-Polchinski equation), 所以呢個係effective field theory嘅睇法。而上面嘅 RG 係所謂嘅 “continuum RG”, 講緊嘅係當你change renormalization scale 嘅時候，啲observable會點變 (Callan-Symanzik equation)。兩者講緊完全唔同嘅嘢。

replies.msg: You can define a primitive of 1/z by omitting any half line from the origin (i.e. a branch cut of log(z)), not only the negative real line. Just that these branch cuts could not patch together to form a function on C \ {0} as their values do not match (differ by integer multiples of 2 pi i). That means any primitive of 1/z would not be defined at some points on the unit circle no matter which branch cut you take.

Chem撚讀緊quantum chemistry唔明

有冇物理巴打可以講下咩係electron spin同埋點解個allowed value 會係+/- 1/2

我學嘅睇法係：
1. 你知道宇宙有 rotational symmetry, given by SO(3),

2. 你想將呢個 symmetry realize 落個 Hilbert space, 所以你想研究嘅係 (unitary) representations of SO(3),

3. 但係我哋並唔 care Hilbert space 入面每支 vector 嘅 overall phase, 因為只有 state vector 嘅 norm squared 係 physically observable,

4. 所以你真正想研究嘅係 representations of SO(3) on projective Hilbert space, i.e. unitary projective representations of SO(3) (Wigner’s theorem),

5. 你嘅數學家朋友會同你講你想要嘅representations可以 “lift” to universal covering group of SO(3), i.e. SU(2) (Bargmann’s theorem),

6. 你同你嘅數學家朋友講，因為你想研究嘅係 “elementary particle”，你想知 SU(2) 最「細」而又唔能夠「被分解」嘅 representation 係咩,

7. 你嘅數學家朋友會話你知你想要嘅 representation 係 two dimensional, with Lie algebra given by Pauli matrices over 2 (差啲 factors of i, 但係我從來都唔會記得 ),

8. 你知道每個 symmetry 都會 correspond to 某個 observable (Noether’s theorem), 基本上就係個 Lie algebra, 所以你想要嘅 observable 就咁啱好 represented as Pauli matrices over 2, 而佢哋嘅 eigenvalues 係 +/- 1/2。

有錯請指正

replies.msg:
兩邊教同學EM個Approach 有少少分別

N展果邊一樣會教Maxwell’s Equations 但之後會落去 Application 部分 (例如 EM Wave , EM Radiation , Antenna 等等)

PHY 果邊 (UG正常都用Griffiths)一樣會教Maxwell’s Equations (Ch.1-7) 之後就睇你行Theoretical/Applied 條路
Applied 的話有啲似N展 (一樣學EM Wave (Ch.9), EM Radiation(Ch.11))
Theoretical 的話就學埋 Gauge Transformation (Ch.10)，仲有EM同Special Relativity(SR) 既密切關係(Ch.12)

利申：兩邊既Course都讀過 但唔好以為讀過PHY果邊既EM 之後去讀N展果邊既EM (或者調返轉)會屈到機 因為兩邊個重點同問法都好唔同

replies.msg:
一般 PHY UG 教 EM 既次序 (同埋用書) :

(Year 1) 初階EM ：概念為主，可以係Calculus - Based (用書/參考書：一般枕頭書 例如 Serway , Young 等等) —>

(Year 2)中階EM ：內容同Year 1 差不多，不過就開始滲少少 Vector Calculus 元素落去 (用書/參考書：Purcell , Feynman Lectures 等等)—>

(Year 3&4)高階EM(或叫EM Theory)：PHY Major四大力學其中一個核心課程，通常都已經假設你有相關數學基礎，例如 Vector Calculus、識Solve 簡單PDE 例如Laplace’s Equation 等等

通常Year 3 會學 Griffiths Ch.1-7 (Electro-/Magneto-statics + Maxwell’s Equations + Electric/Magnetic Fields in Matter)。如果有意上PG的話，就Year 4 讀埋 Ch.8-12 (Electrodynamics+少少SR)
(用書/參考書：最出名嘅Griffiths、真係好勁既甚至直接睇Jackson)

quote.msg:
兩邊教同學EM個Approach 有少少分別

N展果邊一樣會教Maxwell’s Equations 但之後會落去 Application 部分 (例如 EM Wave , EM Radiation , Antenna 等等)

PHY 果邊 (UG正常都用Griffiths)一樣會教Maxwell’s Equations (Ch.1-7) 之後就睇你行Theoretical/Applied 條路
Applied 的話有啲似N展 (一樣學EM Wave (Ch.9), EM Radiation(Ch.11))
Theoretical 的話就學埋 Gauge Transformation (Ch.10)，仲有EM同Special Relativity(SR) 既密切關係(Ch.12)

利申：兩邊既Course都讀過 但唔好以為讀過PHY果邊既EM 之後去讀N展果邊既EM (或者調返轉)會屈到機 因為兩邊個重點同問法都好唔同
多數EM唔係有兩個course 加埋就教哂成本咩

一般 PHY UG 教 EM 既次序 (同埋用書) :

(Year 1) 初階EM ：概念為主，可以係Calculus - Based (用書/參考書：一般枕頭書 例如 Serway , Young 等等) —>

(Year 2)中階EM ：內容同Year 1 差不多，不過就開始滲少少 Vector Calculus 元素落去 (用書/參考書：Purcell , Feynman Lectures 等等)—>

(Year 3&4)高階EM(或叫EM Theory)：PHY Major四大力學其中一個核心課程，通常都已經假設你有相關數學基礎，例如 Vector Calculus、識Solve 簡單PDE 例如Laplace’s Equation 等等

通常Year 3 會學 Griffiths Ch.1-7 (Electro-/Magneto-statics + Maxwell’s Equations + Electric/Magnetic Fields in Matter)。如果有意上PG的話，就Year 4 讀埋 Ch.8-12 (Electrodynamics+少少SR)
(用書/參考書：最出名嘅Griffiths、真係好勁既甚至直接睇Jackson)

replies.msg:
g-2同collider physics唔同既。collider本身有好多analyses，所以有好大既look-else-where effect，好易「撞」個大sigma出嚟。而且本身750 GeV得diphoton channel，其他lepton/jet channel冇仼何excess已經係好奇怪，因為你expect能量高過electroweak symmetry breaking scale既時候，個interaction basis應該係electroweak bosons，而唔係photon或者W/Z bosons，所以如果剩係有diphoton excess，要砌到個750 GeV boson理論個coupling term夾番個Weinberg angle，既係剩係couple落photon唔couple落W/Z boson度，係幾大個theory fine-tuning。加上本身得3 sigmas，所以一開始波已經半信半疑。

相反，g-2個「實驗理論」簡㓗好多（量度spin precession既理論，唔係standard model出發既理論），只係單一量度個spin，唔計實質運作上既挑戰（例如量度spatial field distribution），個g-2數字應該冇乜甩漏。加上Fermi Lab之前，另一個Brookhaven實驗做過差唔多既實驗，十幾年前年既科技同儀器出同一樣既3-sigma結果，所以大家都當呢個3-sigma係真（兩個實驗夾埋4-sigma）。

問題係個結果幾十年前Brookhaven已經做過出嚟，幾十年出papers都出到爛。而且大家唔信既係個standard model theory uncertainty，由其是個QCD vacuum polarization calculation，因為係nonperturbative，要喺電腦用lattice QCD numerically計個path integral，好少行外人識亦都好少人對佢有十足信心，所以lattice QCD一日未改進個結果，一日個4-sigma都係柒既
就算lattice QCD有新進展，都唔算係物理新發現，只係叫做學識點計舊有standard model條數。

Excess 750 ?
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/750_GeV_diphoton_excess
係

g-2同collider physics唔同既。collider本身有好多analyses，所以有好大既look-else-where effect，好易「撞」個大sigma出嚟。而且本身750 GeV得diphoton channel，其他lepton/jet channel冇仼何excess已經係好奇怪，因為你expect能量高過electroweak symmetry breaking scale既時候，個interaction basis應該係electroweak bosons，而唔係photon或者W/Z bosons，所以如果剩係有diphoton excess，要砌到個750 GeV boson理論個coupling term夾番個Weinberg angle，既係剩係couple落photon唔couple落W/Z boson度，係幾大個theory fine-tuning。加上本身得3 sigmas，所以一開始波已經半信半疑。

相反，g-2個「實驗理論」簡㓗好多（量度spin precession既理論，唔係standard model出發既理論），只係單一量度個spin，唔計實質運作上既挑戰（例如量度spatial field distribution），個g-2數字應該冇乜甩漏。加上Fermi Lab之前，另一個Brookhaven實驗做過差唔多既實驗，十幾年前年既科技同儀器出同一樣既3-sigma結果，所以大家都當呢個3-sigma係真（兩個實驗夾埋4-sigma）。

問題係個結果幾十年前Brookhaven已經做過出嚟，幾十年出papers都出到爛。而且大家唔信既係個standard model theory uncertainty，由其是個QCD vacuum polarization calculation，因為係nonperturbative，要喺電腦用lattice QCD numerically計個path integral，好少行外人識亦都好少人對佢有十足信心，所以lattice QCD一日未改進個結果，一日個4-sigma都係柒既
